snippet: Black and Hispanic leaders in New York, one of the most diverse states in the nation, are growing increasingly concerned about their standing in state government.
abstract: Black and Hispanic leaders in New York are growing increasingly concerned about their standing in state government; they worry that coalition of Republicans and dissident Democrats, who have taken control of State Senate and consist entirely of white lawmakers, will prevent Senate Democratic caucus, which includes 14 blacks and Hispanics, from taking power.
lead_paragraph: Black and Hispanic leaders in New York, one of the most diverse states in the nation, are growing increasingly concerned about their standing in state government.

headline.seo: Minority Senators Say Independent Democratic Conference Robs Them
headline.main: G.O.P. Senate Deal: Diversity Takes Back Seat to Power in Albany
headline.print_headline: G.O.P. Senate Deal: Diversity Takes Back Seat to Power in Albany
